kulami.control

Class GameController

  • java.lang.Object
    • kulami.control.GameController

  • public class GameController
extends java.lang.Object
    The GameController is the layer between the GUI and the game state.

    The GUI delegates all user input to the controller and lets the controller decide what to do. The controller also receives Kulami server messages. The controller decides which actions to take and manipulates the game model.

    The GameController's only public element is its constructor. Messages are received in anonymous classes that implement adapter interfaces.

    Author:
    gordon

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameController

        public GameController()
        Constructs a GameController, initializes a Mainframe object and displays it.

        The constructor also requests a MessagePager and a StatusDisplayer from the Mainframe to display information to the user

    • Method Detail

      • initMainframe

        private void initMainframe()
        Initializes the Mainframe.

        An anonymous inner class that implements the interface MainframeAdapter handles user input at the mainframe.

      • showMapEditor

        private void showMapEditor()
        Shows the MapEditor by creating a new MapEditorController.

      • showPlayerDialog

        private void showPlayerDialog()
        Displays the PlayerDialog which prompts the user to enter a user name and decide whether to play in human or in computer mode.

        An anonymous inner class that implements the PlayerDialogAdapter interface handles user input from the PlayerDialog.

      • showNewGameDialog

        private void showNewGameDialog()
        Displays the NewGameDialog which prompts the user for a Kulami server connection.

        An anonymous inner class that implements the NewGameDialogAdapter interface handles user input from the dialog.

        The PlayerDialog should have been displayed before.

      • showChooseBoardDialog

        private void showChooseBoardDialog()
        Displays the ChooseBoardDialog which prompts the user to choose a board from a file and a level for counting of points.

        An anonymous inner class that implements the ChoosBoardDialogAdapter interface handles user input from the dialog.

        This method should be called when the user connected to the server first and the server requested game parameters.

      • registerInProtocolObserver

        private void registerInProtocolObserver()
        Registers an anonymous inner class that implements the InProtocolObserver interface with the ServerAdapter.

        The anonymous inner class handles all incoming server messages and initiates appropriate action.

      • startGameDisplay

        private void startGameDisplay()
        Tells the mainframe to initialize the GameDisplay with the current game.

        An anonymous inner class that implements the GameDisplayAdapter interface handles user clicks on the board display.

        Before calling this method, a Game object has to be assigned to the game field.

      • initStatusDisplay

        private void initStatusDisplay()
        Sets the status display to its initial values.

      • updateStatusDisplay

        private void updateStatusDisplay()
        Updates the number of remaining marbles and current points in the status display.

      • createPlayer

        private Player createPlayer()
        Creates a new Player object.

        The fields playerHuman, playerName, playerColour, and compPlayerLevel have to be initialized before calling this method.

        Returns:
        a HumanPlayer or a CompPlayer

      • makeMove

        private void makeMove()
        Tell a CompPlayer to make a move.

        An anonymous inner class that implements the CompPlayerAdapter interface is used to receive the chosen move.
